entry.title: Out of the Ashes
entry.summary:
Author: houseofquills

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 65,642Chapters: 12/?Kudos: 161

Summary: Eddie Diaz thought he could leave his past behind, building a new life for his son Christopher and shielding him from the darkness that once defined him. But when he steps into the 118 firehouse, his carefully constructed walls begin to crack. Among the chaos and camaraderie of his new team, one person stands out—Evan “Buck” Buckley, a man whose magnetic warmth and reckless charm threaten to unravel everything Eddie has kept buried.As Eddie navigates the firehouse’s relentless demands, he finds himself drawn to Buck in ways he can’t explain—and doesn’t entirely trust. But it’s not just Eddie’s life Buck begins to change. Christopher, with his wide-eyed innocence, sees Buck as more than a friend, pulling him into their world in a way that feels inevitable. Yet beneath Eddie’s quiet smiles and gentle fatherhood lies a darker truth: Eddie doesn’t just want Buck in their lives—he needs him. And he’s willing to do whatever it takes to make sure Buck stays.Will Buck see the shadows behind Eddie’s steady gaze before it’s too late? Or will their connection ignite a fire that neither of them can control? Out of the Ashes is a story of love, obsession, and the lengths we go to claim what we believe is ours.

entry.title: In your eyes, my reflection
entry.summary:
Author: ParadiseDarkness26

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 1,410Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 0

Summary: Buck constantly tells Eddie how beautiful he is, but Eddie doesn’t believe it until, over time, he starts to accept Buck’s words. At different moments, Eddie struggles with his insecurities, but eventually, thanks to Buck’s patience, he begins to believe in his own beauty and see himself through the same loving eyes Buck sees him with. In the end, Eddie feels whole, accepting and loving who he is.5+1: Five times Buck tried to convince Eddie that he is beautiful, and once Eddie admits it.

entry.title: Growing Pains
entry.summary:
Author: TheCaptain42

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 18,289Chapters: 9/12Kudos: 127

Summary: Chris and Eddie are still working to regain trust. Chris isn't ready to come home yet. But he calls his dad with big news.*“Dad…”, Chris sighed, “Izzy’s my boyfriend.”*---Chris comes out as bi while in Texas. In the aftermath Eddie finally reflects his own past and future relationships. Maybe it's finally time to open the lid to the box of trauma Eddie had previously tidied so neatly away. Maybe it's time to reckon with the loss of Shannon, with his childhood in El Paso and why nothing ever quite works out for him. Buck is nothing but helpful of course. It's the year of gay awakenings.----(Mostly) Canon Compliant until season 8 ep 08 (though distinct lack of bees due to work-life balance) - this is a fic accompanying Eddie's character development in season 8

entry.title: The Feeling of Abandonment
entry.summary:
Author: KivaRose

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 2,490Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 39

Summary: Set after Buck and Eddie's confrontation at the station in 8x09, Bobby takes Eddie aside to help him work through his emotions about Buck's reactions.This fic in no way places the blame on either Buck or Eddie for their spat, but I had this conversation in my head and couldn't let it go. Because Buck cops a lot of shit about his very valid emotions, and Eddie doesn't often understand, because both of our boys are oblivious and we love them for it and get frustrated by them in equal measure. Sometimes they both just need a helping hand.

entry.title: Lost My Love in Texas
entry.summary:
Author: lys_fanfic_reads

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 2,180Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 68

Summary: Eddie shakes his head, like he can’t believe he’s saying it out loud. “You’ve been in my life for seven years. Seven years, Buck. And somewhere along the way, you stopped being just my best friend. You became—” He stops, takes a breath. “You became the most important person in my life. And that? That terrifies me.” Eddie exhales sharply, turning away for a moment, his hands gripping the back of the couch like he needs to hold onto something solid. “But I don’t get to fall apart over this, Buck,” he says finally, voice shaking. “I don’t have that option.”So, I crashed out and wrote this while crying my eyes out. But it's basically what I was dreaming would happen at the end of 809. Please forgive if there are errors or some parts don't make sense as I was in mental despair. Please enjoy and Tim take notes.

entry.title: Badly Beaten Self Esteem Has Got Me Needing You
entry.summary:
Author: bvddiesbro

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 13,017Chapters: 3/8Kudos: 41

Summary: Who did he think he was anyway, strolling into the 118 with his hair and his body and his eyes, with a smirk that bled confidence. Who did he think he was to appear and insert himself into their family like he belonged when Buck himself had grafted, scraped and clawed his way to belonging.He could feel Bobby’s eyes on him, he could feel Hen wanting to reach out, could feel Chimney’s confusion but they didn’t understand. This, the firehouse, this team, this family was his. It was all Buck had. They didn’t understand how threatened he felt, his hackles raised and chest tense everytime Bobby clapped Eddie on the shoulder. They didn’t know about the nausea that clawed at him every time Chimney poked fun at Buck, with Eddie. They couldn’t fathom the way his head spun every time Hen complimented Eddie on his skills as a medic, sounding genuinely impressed.OrBuck has some serious undiagnosed mental health issues, pushes them aside and becomes everyone's sounding board, soaks up their problems and ignores his own, until he can't anymore.OrBuck slowly realises that maybe he's not a burden, that he doesn't need to make his problems smaller to make room for others.
